column4: Hey, I just installed ubuntu and I use 2 monitors from one ghpx card - one is displaying 1280x1024 ok but the other is 'zoomed in' and you move the mouse to look around - how can I get around that?
does anyone know?
Hi, I just installed ubuntu and I use 2 monitors from one ghpx card - one is displaying 1280x1024 ok but the other is 'zoomed in' and you move the mouse to look around - how can I get around that?
anyone know about my display problem?
I feel like I am talking to myself here
look I have already asked the REAL question TWICE
and it was ignored
it just narks me that some goon who wants to 'download da music' gets advise but a real problem goes IGNORED
I just installed ubuntu and I use 2 monitors from one ghpx card - one is displaying 1280x1024 ok but the other is 'zoomed in' and you move the mouse to look around - how can I get around that?
edit xorg.conf and make sure the 2nd monitor gets a different resolution...
ubuntu thinks I only have one monitor I think - it beleives the res is 1280x1024
then you'll have to teach ubuntu by editing xorg.conf
in what way?
thats quite a statement
nonsense
you have told me to edit the xorg.cong file - without even saying how
I have the file up - but I dunno what bit needs changing
I agree
might you know the answer to my woe's ?
yes, very bizarre indeeed but please move on with life and forget it
do u know anything bout the gnome menu and/or the whole .desktop files thing?
got a conundrum :P
the question is: will vista be a viable competitor to Ubuntu
- thats not my question
